headlines.description: Bournemouth drew 0-0 with Wolverhampton Wanderers in the Premier League on Wednesday in their first game under caretaker manager Gary O'Neil.
headlines.shortLinkText: Battling Bournemouth hold Wolves to stalemate

headlines.description: Arsenal continued their perfect start to the season, making it five wins from five games after a 2-1 victory over Aston Villa on Wednesday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Arsenal remain perfect with win over Aston Villa

headlines.description: Erling Haaland continued the hot start to his Manchester City career by scoring a hat trick inside 38 minutes in a win over Nottingham Forest.
headlines.shortLinkText: Red-hot Haaland hat trick as City rout Forest

events.name: Tottenham Hotspur at West Ham United

headlines.description: — Club-record signing Lucas Paqueta had a chance to score a late winner for West Ham but in the end it had to be content with a 1-1 draw against London rival Tottenham on Wednesday and its first home point of the season.
headlines.shortLinkText: West Ham rallies for 1-1 draw against Tottenham in EPL

headlines.description: — Substitute Fabio Carvalho sent Anfield wild by scrambling home a goal in the eighth minute of stoppage time as Liverpool beat Newcastle 2-1 for a second straight Premier League win on Wednesday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Carvalho's stoppage-time goal earns Liverpool dramatic win
